proper order; and that the men are properly attired and fit for duty; and report to the command-
ARTICLE V.
POLICEMEN.
Sec. 1. In the organization of the Police, the
first object in view is the prevention of crime, and
hence the exertions of Policemen must be constantly used to accomplish that end. To this effect
they must examine and make themselves perfectly
acquainted with every part of their beat, and vigilantly watch every description of person passing
their way, so as to acquire a faculty in observing
as well as in detecting offenders.
Sec. 2. Each Policeman^ must, to the utmost
of his power, prevent the commission of assaults,
breaches of the peace, and all other crimes about
to be.committed.
Sec. 3. He must by his vigilance render it extremely difficult for any one to commit crime on","fullrs":{},"find":"2665.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2664","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"459387","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.44 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
